website_summaries.verdict: The hefty price aside, the Asus AC2400 RT-AC87U is the most complete 802.11ac router to date, capable of satisfying all your home networking needs.
pros: The Asus AC2400 RT-AC87U Dual-band Wireless Gigabit Router has superfast Wi-Fi speed and an extremely long range
The router has the the ability to keep viruses and malware from entering your home network, monitor Internet traffic in real time, and many other helpful features
cons: The router is expensive, and you need compatible Wi-Fi devices to benefit from its fast performance
The USB 3.0 port is awkwardly placed, and the interface doesn't include client names in the IP reservation list

website_summaries.verdict: The Asus RT-AC87 Dual-band Wireless-AC2400 Gigabit Router is the first 4x4 wireless router on the market. It's an exciting excellent device, but until there are compatible adapters, there's not much to set it apart from Asus's last 802.11ac router.
cons: Worse throughput and range in 802.11ac mode than recent, less-expensive Asus routers
Enabling QoS did not reduce time to buffer and stream video

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, no meaningful support from ASUS.
customer_reviews.text: After a few months of operation, the 2.4GHz band stopped functioning. When I did a live chat with ASUS, they gave me one option, which was to send it in for service. 5-7 day turnaround time at best. That means having to buy another router to stay connected while the router that failed is out of commission. When I suggested they simply replace the item and I would send this one back to them, they refused. The idea that anyone in business can afford to have no connectivity for such a duration is laughable. Either way, I have to buy another router, so this time I am not buying ASUS. Terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Charles London

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than three months.
customer_reviews.text: This router lasted less than 3 months, it just quit working. Power was on, but network would not recognize the device. Good thing I kept my old Linksys router. I'm a little upset that I had to pay over $30 to send it back to be fixed under warranty. I personally feel that they should have payed for shipping during the warranty period. Update: Product was returned to me today (almost a full month later), with wireless DOA. Tech support did not answer phone after 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: I'm VERY disappointed! Maybe because I have little experience
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for parental controls. I'm VERY disappointed! Maybe because I have little experience. But, my daughters are able to get through a back door on Minecraft and link to each other. Also able to text, etc. Mobile app is all on/off, and then it completely erases the programed blackout time. Range and speed is AMAZING. Certainly handles the 20+ devices we have running on it. Range is great- it sits in our basement and I no longer have any problem getting coverage in a second-floor corner bedroom. It's a good router, just not as great for parental controls as I'd hoped. Might be user ignorance, but certainly it isn't a plug-n-play for parental controls
customer_reviews.author: N. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: router not quite what I expected from ASUS ...steer away from this model
customer_reviews.text: I received a problematic unit the first time around...it just wouldn't work after the firmware update download (these things happen in a blue moon)( ordered on Monday,got it on Wednesday,returned on same day, and received second unit on Saturday, way to go Amazon,thanks), ....Second item also had issues.....it started dropping my internet connection insenssantly after two days of usage.....Sorry.......hope this helps ;) I just don't trust this model anymore....right? However......AMAZON rocks....way to go Amazon.....shopping with you is always a pleasure. My older Dlink backup router never has issues....it's just older....a lot older.... :)
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Miguel Berard

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well for three weeks, then the 2.4GHz radio band stopped working. Through ASUS customer support, I have to send it in to be repaired, as ASUS will not replace networking equipment, meaning I will be out of a wireless router for weeks. I will persue support through Amazon, but as a lifelong ASUS customer (laptops, computer parts/hardware, routers) I am extremely disappointed and will cease to do business with them because of this faulty product.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great router with many features and performance even while on a budget
customer_reviews.text: This is a truly amazing router. Being an IT pro for several years now I was looking for a great router that was still budget friendly. I still do not regret having this considering all the many option the software offers. Pros: Security, network storage, bandwith, Parental Control. Cons: The software can get very confusing and overwhelming at times even for me. I found myself having to google for certain options a few times even after having used them before.
customer_reviews.author: roberto zeeuw

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed performance!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the performance of this router. I purchased this thinking I was going to get an upgrade from my current $89.99 netgear router and I actually so far have seen worse performance. Where I was getting half strength WiFi on the other side of the house I'm now seeing almost 0 signal. My wife's smart scale used to connect and sync without issue to the old router and now it won't connect unless it's brought closer. This router is located in the exact same spot as the old one. May be putting this back in it's box and hooking up my old router because it worked........
customer_reviews.author: SBMC

customer_reviews.title: Router problems at 5ghz
customer_reviews.text: So far I've had nothing but problems with the 5ghz connection. The 2.4ghz works faster with an 802.11ac connection than the 5ghz one. I've updated the firmware to the latest version and totally reset the router numerous times. No difference. Please note: I am connecting from a room across the hallway, not more than 15 feet away. There is almost a direct line of sight to the router via the doorway. If this is too far away for 5ghz, it makes it pretty useless to use with our home. I'm very disappointed and am thinking of reverting back to my older AC68 router. In my opinion it has been a waste of $240 so far.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Sam

customer_reviews.title: ASUS support has been TERRIBLE so far - lots of work and follow up ...
customer_reviews.text: Lots of potential, but as a previous poster wrote, the 5GHz band drops very regularly. It appears the RF connection is strong, so it may be a firmware bug. In addition, the unit does not retain an assigned IP address in access point mode. I have two of these units - both exhibit the exact same problems. ASUS support has been TERRIBLE so far - lots of work and follow up on my side, no resolution from their side. I would definitely recommend avoiding this router for now.
customer_reviews.author: G. Corcoran

customer_reviews.title: Great connectivity and range
customer_reviews.text: Awesome router, never had any issues with it. Run a switch into it and it handles all hardwired connections and multiple gaming laptops, phones, and smart TVs with no issues. Has a very long range and cover mys 1200 square foot house and almost my entire acre of land!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Darrell Sluder

customer_reviews.title: Depressingly Flawed
customer_reviews.text: No surprises with the setup, GUI, range, features, it just does not work. Example: watch one episode via Netflix, Hulu, etc. - everything is fine. Then, during the transition to the next episode, internet connectivity drops out, while the network stays intact. Waiting a few minutes it will figure things out and reconnect - this was also the case while simply browsing the internet. ASUS products usually outstanding and tech support's answer to the problem was to "return the item". I hoped I would be one of the lucky ones that had a great experience with this router but unfortunately I got one of the bad eggs.
customer_reviews.author: LynchNephalem

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t last 2 years . Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Is my second ASUS router & the last one . Previous router , RT-N66U Dark Knight lasted about 18 months & this one about 16 months . I am averaging about $150 a year for the past 4 years in ASUS wireless routers . My precious D-Link lasted almost 7 years and I simply replaced because I wanted something faster . Will not buy another ASUS ever again .
customer_reviews.author: E=MC2

customer_reviews.title: A Solid Router.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Asus routers and both have been rock solid. I have a pretty good connection (no gigabit as yet, though), but I live in an older home with thick walls. Some of the wall surfaces are made from steel expanded mesh and grout. Needless to say, signal degradation has always been a problem. I have an upstairs network and a downstairs network. At he strongest points I can get around 170-180mbps and at the weakest maybe 35-40 mbps. I do both streaming and IoT stuff that incorporates an Amazon Echo and 4 Echo dots. I have never had anything that failed due to insufficient signal strength. For me, that's the point.
customer_reviews.author: Gilly

customer_reviews.title: Very happy customer. Full bandwith realized on my network.
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!! Geez this thing is great. OK, OK,, It is just miles better that the router it replaced. I was using a AC1700 rated TPLink router. My connection was capping at around 15 Mbps per second. I tested after the modem upgrade and new usb wireless sticks. When I dropped the router into the mix my test for download increased to nearly 150 Mbps (what I actually pay for). Should have done this months ago. Beware of lower rated equipment.
customer_reviews.author: TexMo

customer_reviews.title: Firmware update broke router - sending it back.
customer_reviews.text: Installed the router. Everything was fine. Upgraded the firmware and now I can't login to the settings. ASUS tech support has no idea why not. I'll give it a day or two and then this router is going back. At this price, I expect it to work perfectly. Update: No solution from ASUS. Already swapped this for a Netgear Nighthawk that has performed perfectly right out of the box. Also, the ASUS provided NO real increase in wifi range. The Nighthawk has delivered the improvement in range that I would have expected with a brand new wifi router. Spend the additional $20 and get the Nighthawk.
customer_reviews.author: Zaggie

customer_reviews.title: ... needed the range and so far it has been crap. First one lasted about 2 weeks and then ...
customer_reviews.text: On my second one as i needed the range and so far it has been crap. First one lasted about 2 weeks and then drops in and out and works for about 15min after reboot and then back to dropping and slow speeds. Asus just have me Rest it and it works for a day or 2 then right back. Bought another one to see if that would help and Nope after 3 months same thing. My old router was 3yrs old and the one before that were even older. These are Junk with a big price tag. Just what we have come to expect, works great for a short time like 30days then junk. will not buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome wireless range
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router, love the interface Asus uses. This thing can handle a bunch of traffic with ease and gets great reception. These are easily the best router on the market right now for the money. UPDATE Installed two more of these and WOW the wireless range is incredible. Both the 2.4 and 5 ghz bands had 5 bars at over 50' through metal and concrete walls in a commercial setting. The firmware patches are easy to install and come out without delay (though you have to log in to the router to install them manually). The GUI is easy to use and the best in the industry.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: After exactly 9 months of operating, my router after having extreme issues of wifi connectivity over both bands 6 months in, crapped out and would no longer connect even over LAN ethernet connection. I hate to say it, I love all other Asus products, but these routers have issues in less than a year and literally become paperweights. Asus is ruining what little rep they have left in the router industry.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Great with VPN Service
customer_reviews.text: Love this Router. It took me a couple of weeks to decide to buy it because the reviews were not has good as I had hoped. I have two Surface Pro 3's, two Smart phones(5G) a WD MyCloud connected wired and three wireless camera's running on 2G. No hiccups, no problems. I am also running a VPN Service nativity on this router (which is why I purchased it in the first place) and after a little tweaking I am still able to get my full ISP speed while it is connected to the VPN Service 30D/3U. This router doubled the range and speed of my old Linksys router. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: This unit worked GREAT for 6mo
customer_reviews.text: This unit worked GREAT for 6mo... Then all of a sudden the connection would get lost and RED light would be on, indicating no internet. Moto Surfboard modem all BLUE and working, so I would have to turn off the ASUS and then turn it back on to get it to connect. This happened a few times weekly, and now daily! Support is useless! ONE BIG DOORSTOP!!!! * * STAY AWAY * *
customer_reviews.author: One Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Consistent problems with this thing, happening more frequently after eight months to one year of use. The most common problem is that the router will completely drop all connections and require a reboot (sometimes the router interface can still be accessed via the 2.4GHz band, and ONLY the 2.4GHz band). This happens randomly, but more frequently as time goes on (from a once a month issue to bi-weekly now). Also had one port completely fail after about one year of use. Buying a Netgear instead.
customer_reviews.author: Zero

customer_reviews.title: Good Router imho
customer_reviews.text: I've built many PC's, and set up many networks. I like this router, and it's capabilities both to deal wiht the new speeds out now, and also options in the UI. Though, sometimes it seems like it could be a more "user-friendly" UI. Also, occasionally it seems like the settings don't take effect immediately and/or the router wants to reboot, or does reboot on its' own when you would not think that would be necessary for the simple change made in the UI. However, overall, I like the Router, and am satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonianBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great potential
customer_reviews.text: The ASUS Router provided great features, even more than what a regular user will ever need. However, I was looking forward to enabling the newest features of the product to take advantage of things like a private VPN, File Sharing, etc. A few weeks after I enabled these features, I noticed a slowness on the network. While troubleshooting, I got a notice that a new firmware version was available. I updated the firmware expecting it to fix the issues, but now my router will not accept new clients. A router with features that break the network when enabled is not too useful.
customer_reviews.author: ERM

customer_reviews.title: Set-Up was super easy. Router access software very user friendly and ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so god. Router worked exactly as advertised right out of the box. Set-Up was super easy. Router access software very user friendly and easy to set-up. I will update this review as I use the product and run some speed and performance tests. But so far, I have no complaints, concerns or issues. One thing to be aware of: this router is BIG and heavy. And it;s not the kind of hardware you orient vertically to safe space. I persoanlly like electronic equipment that is big and hefty but for those of you who like to have their devices tucked away and unobtrusive, this unit mmay be a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Cafiero

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Good Range
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this for about a week but I have noticed much faster streaming speeds. I have 3 AppleTV's, and 3 iPads connected and sometimes streaming all at once and so far no drop offs or freezing. Also the 5G seems to give me more range then my last one I don't have a huge house but one AppleTV is in the basement and I get a good connection. I did not update the firmware as I heard issues with doing that so I was afraid to but seems to working fine with old firmware so not in a hurry to update it. If I run into any issues I will add to the post.
customer_reviews.author: Nevets

customer_reviews.title: experienced home wifi router installer. bought this one to ...
customer_reviews.text: experienced home wifi router installer. bought this one to replace a 2.5yr old NT-N66R that overnight had a hardware failure on the WAN port so could not connect to the modem. had repeated problems after installing the AC87U with connecting to and staying connected to both 2.4ghz and 5ghz networks (including guest). noticed that default setting for MU-MIMO was OFF. It has a phrase next to is saying it is still beta and being approved. knowing this has been around for some time I enabled it. many more options then appeared after it installed. i left these additional options with their default settings and all my connectivity problems went away.
customer_reviews.author: SFM

customer_reviews.title: No more buffering
customer_reviews.text: Buffering problems finally solved! We are in a large (2686 sq. ft.) home and could not get a stable connection from our internet modem to our various wireless devices. My Amazon Fire TVs (3) constantly buffered. I hooked this router to the modem with 25 ft. CAT7, which allowed me to move the router to a more central location and all problems were solved. I love the fact that you can aim it where you need it to go and the signal has no problems with walls and ceilings. Even though my modem is a 2.5G, I can get a 5G signal. It is very powerful and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: smokinjj

customer_reviews.title: Aweesome Performance
customer_reviews.text: Really thrilled with the performance of this router. A bit more expensive than I would have liked, but it lives up to the many numerous professional endorsements. I replaced an older Cisco router, and this blows it away. I now have coverage throughout my entire 3 floor house and use it to stream movies wirelessly and wired to Apple TV and an Amazon Firestick. It supports a house full of 5 people and all their iPads, laptops, and mobile phones. The UI is pretty comprehensive and set up is a breeze. The QAS functionality is really helpful as well as the ability filter adult or rated content to individual deices. Wish I had purchased this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: STK

customer_reviews.title: I bought this router in May 2016. The WAN ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router in May 2016. The WAN port stopped working after few months. I tried resetting the router to factory settings, still no luck. The wifi is working and so are lan ethernet ports, as I can connect laptops to the router through lan ports. However, the router is not able to communicate to neither ATT gigabit nor Comcast xfinity modem. Not sure what else to try. This was a pricey modem and I am not looking forward to spend lot of my time in contacting Asus tech support.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: An expensive paperweight
customer_reviews.text: Same problems as the most helpful negative review. Wireless signal constantly dropping and the range is abysmal, which is ridiculous considering that the router boasts a coverage area of 5000 square feet. I've had my ISP send techs to evaluate my connection and all three concluded the issue was with the router. I flashed ASUS firmware, old and new, to try to resolve the problem, nothing worked. I'm extremely dissatisfied with this product. I have submitted a service request to ASUS. Unless this request turns out satisfactorily I will not be giving ASUS my business in the future. Stay away from this router.
customer_reviews.author: negativ ed

customer_reviews.title: I am disappoint.
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE for gaming. As I am writing this review my Download speed is 88.26 Mbps. My Upload is 100.45 Mbps. My ping is 1 ms. Sounds good right?!? But yet I can't play any games online without annoying lag or rubber banding. I have setup SEVERAL wireless routers in the past and have never seen an issue like this. When I was gaming on my ps4 I thought it was just packet loss or something, but even on my computer the issue is there. If I wire in my computer or ps4 there isn't lag. Only when I am wireless. Kind of a joke for how much this wireless router was.
customer_reviews.author: Showtunes

customer_reviews.title: avoid at all costs
customer_reviews.text: Awesome hardware, absolute crap software. I tried, really I tried, for almost 5 months to get this router to be stable. Asus was releasing beta firmware weekly to try and address issues and never was able to put something out that could keep the router from having constant issues. Avoid at all costs, pick up a Asus RT-AC68U and throw tomato shibby on it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great router for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Love using this router to provide wifi to all floors of my home, even the basement when the router is on the second floor in the office. Not one deadspot in my old construction 2400 sq foot home with plaster walls and hardwood floors. The USB 3 port pairs nicely with the Thermaltake blacX duet 5g to become alow cost reliable NAS with good hard drives. I recommend Wd Red drives or other NAS drives for this application.
customer_reviews.author: Josh (slayerXcore) Kimble

customer_reviews.title: this thing is fantastic. Unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: When it works, this thing is fantastic. Unfortunately, I'm on number 2 and this one also has issues. The first would just drop internet completely to anything connected to it. I was having to reboot it 3 or 4 times a week. I sent it back and the replacement is only marginally better. This one drops the 5Ghz channel often enough but the 2.4Ghz is fine. It's a shame that a product with so much potential is such a seething pile of $#!^. ASUS tech support isn't any better. I'm not sure if there are better choices out there as I think all consumer grade WAP's are going to be hit or miss..
customer_reviews.author: Zorecati

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt allow older devices to connect
customer_reviews.text: The 2.4GHz wifi connection isn't compatible with my older devices. My Windows PC (802.11n 2.4GHz) and Harmony Hub won't connect to it. I tried a lot of customization of settings, but can't find anything that works. Both the 5GHz and the 2.4GHz connections work great with my newer Apple devices. It's pretty frustrating that I cant get everything to connect. My older devices connect to my Asus RT-N66U with no problem. I let it sit in the box for a while after I bough it, so no refund for me :(
customer_reviews.author: jamespf

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: Unstable. Constantly having to reboot. Tried firmware updates only to have more problems. Asus support is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Best router i have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best router I have owned. Lots of features that I can access and manage directly from my app on my phone. Best feature for families is being able to turn off internet access to any device in the house from my phone, or just all of them at once.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan D McEntire

customer_reviews.title: I'd expect such an expensive router of a better signal strength
customer_reviews.text: Looks fancy and claims to have many funcationalities. However, It drops connection constantly. Granted that I live in an apartment with many wifi signals, I'd expect such an expensive router of a better signal strength. I returned it and replaced it with $30 linksys router, much better signal strengch and no more drops. What a joke!!
customer_reviews.author: Du Yi

customer_reviews.title: Good router
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Excellent speed. Solid connections, no dropouts. Excellent software interface. Range is comparable to other (D-Link, Asus, Netgear) routers I've used. What I like best about this router is that it's been trouble free you just set it up and forget about it! PLEASE NOTE: My location is not congested with other routers. The nearest routers to me (4 of them) are about 200 feet away and are all set to different channels than mine so not much competition for bandwidth or channels.
customer_reviews.author: SuprFun

customer_reviews.title: Just Wow.
customer_reviews.text: Just Wow. I'm replacing a Cisco 4200 router... a SOLID router two years ago that gave me a very robust signal, but didn't quite cut it at the extremes of distances and walls in my home which is about 4500 square feet. now, using speedtest.net, I get about 30-40mbits/sec pretty much everywhere in an 80% radius of the router, and in the last 20% i get about 10-20mbits/sec .. extremely impressive. I get this upstairs, on the first level (where the router sits) and in the basement. it is a stable connection everywhere. I am very impressed... well worth this $200!! Thank you Asus. I was able to get rid of a couple repeaters...

customer_reviews.title: fast router
customer_reviews.text: I bought the renewed router. It works just fine. Fast functional router. The router gets warm so it is advisable to use some furniture lifts on the corners to allow for heat greater dissipation. This will extend the life of the router.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this router for 2 months now and its terrible. The first one I had died about 7 days after getting it, luckily I could get a new one from amazon with no trouble. Now for the replacement, 5ghz drops out constantly, terrible lag on the entire system, have to reboot at least twice a week. Unfortunately I cannot get my money back so I will just throw this POS in the garbage and go with a company that makes good routers. Last time I use ASUS for routers.
customer_reviews.author: Audiorazor

customer_reviews.title: Great router, but requires some tweaking out-of-the-box.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing router. BUT I have one warning for Beginners/Non-Tech Users, I notice a lot of people complaining about spotty coverage on the 5 Ghz band but this is mostly due to interference from electrical equipment in your home/office area. The easiest way to rectify any connectivity issues would be to ask their support for recommended channel bandwith settings. Some devices prefer one frequency over the other and sometimes putting your router on a less busy frequency can greatly improve performance. I would only recommend this router if you don't mind learning about the features it has.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Jones

customer_reviews.title: Not the power house i was hoping for but a great product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace an Apple Airport Extreme. I know installations are subjective but based on reviews and internet research i thought that this would noticeably improve my Wifi performance...not so much. It seems about the same. For those that like to get deep in the settings the interface seems well laid out. I am not that person but even for me setup was simple and i was up and running in no time.
customer_reviews.author: EVO

customer_reviews.title: Random Reboots
customer_reviews.text: When it works its great but it likes to reboot at least once a day which is very inconvenient. After some research it looks as if this is a know issue. I sure hope ASUS support can get this fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Luker

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable router  and poor warranty support
customer_reviews.text: $200+ ASUS RT AC87U wireless AC 2400 Dual Band router totally died (no lights or power at all) after 20 months of light home use. ASUS warranty process a terrible pain as I must pay to mail router back for possible repairs and do without a router for 2 weeks. They won't provide a refund so I can order a new one and get it tomorrow. It took almost 25 minutes on ASUS warranty line to get RMA when I had all information ready at time of call. I may just forget the warranty and order a new LinkSys as my old one was totally reliable for many, many, years.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: and I'm glad I went through the hassle of setting up a ...
customer_reviews.text: This router was an upgrade from an older one, and I'm glad I went through the hassle of setting up a new system, mostly because the user interface options. Well done, well thought out, and very informative. As a casual user there's way more info in the software than I'll ever use, but the at a glance summarization of security, etc, is great. The phone app is well done too, and shows connections, status, data usages, and more. It is a solid unit and high performer with great software.
customer_reviews.author: richard hopfner

customer_reviews.title: This is the best router I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best router I've ever owned. I have 20+ devices connected to it (10 wireless + 10 wired). I load tested it by streaming five simultaneous 1080p video streams from my NAS that's connected wired to the router to 5 wireless devices (Nvidia Shield TV, iPad, Galaxy S7 Edge, and 2 laptops). All wifi streams were flawless and two devices were across two walls. I like it's advanced features like the traffic analyzer and advanced QoS. It's also highly rated by SmallNetBuilder, Cnet, and other router review sites. I highly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Tek1

customer_reviews.title: Quick setup and firmware updated on initial install works GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: 192.168.1.1 for do it yourself set up. Or follow instructions enclosed in box documents. Go to Asus.com and get the latest firmware. Standard Asus interface to set it up along with the addition of Trend Micro router virus protection that protects the router. Does NOT interfere with my Kaspersky 3.0 system anti-virus. Easy set up, very good speeds and just keeps chugging along....... Will update review after I get more time with the product..... Updated- 11/16/2014- Asus router has been FLAWLESS, no problems.....VERY fast!!
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Everything works fine when it is up but it just doesn't stay ...
customer_reviews.text: Router is unreliable and must be rebooted every 1-3 days. Everything works fine when it is up but it just doesn't stay up that long. I'm using the latest firmware which I thought was the resolution to the problem which appeared to make all the negative comments stop earlier this year. These problems still exist. The strength of the signal and the throughput are excellent when the connections are alive. The periodic connection loses happen on both bands simultaneously. The SSID's are still being broadcast but devices will not reconnect without rebooting the router. Rebooting the router brings everything back to life for awhile however this is unacceptable for a product like this (regardless of price range).
customer_reviews.author: Peggy B. Warner

customer_reviews.title: Review of ASUS AC2400
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a router that could fix dead zones in our house. Our home is only 1400 square feet but our other N router was not reaching many places with high speed. The install was really easy and I really like the router configuration page. Lots of features for configuration. Speeds are great in the house. 120 megabits fiber and it doesn’t matter where you are. I have 100mb internet. Not sure how I’m getting additional 20 mb’s:)
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Router!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this router for just over 2 years. It's been awesome. Very strong signal everywhere in our large house, and even outside to a distance of over 100'. Delivers the throughput speed we purchase from our cable provider with no issues. The maintenance/setup application is easy to understand and access. I've recommended this product to friends and they've been equally happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: This router is a total piece of junk. Loses ...
customer_reviews.text: This router is a total piece of junk. Loses connection all the time, at lease twice a day. The first one that I ordered was a brick, ordered a second one hoping for success. Again, junk. Got it working for a short amount of time (about 6 months) and tried to set up an AP using another ASUS router and the thing bricked. Won't ever be buying ASUS again, this is going back RMA.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher D. Klos

customer_reviews.title: Quit after 15 months, repair process costly and takes weeks
customer_reviews.text: The ASUS RT-AC87U...It worked for about 15 months, then it stopped working. It wouldn't pick up an IPv4 address from the modem for more than 5 seconds. Then it would drop again. They are offering to fix it through their repair process which requires that I pay for shipping and takes about 2 weeks to get evaluated and returned. I wish I could return it and get one coming sooner, i'm stuck with an old router that has issues, but more responsive than this one. For this price, I would expect this to work for 5+ years.  ̄\_(ツ)_/ ̄ meh
customer_reviews.author: trofeewife

customer_reviews.title: Great Range
customer_reviews.text: Very impressive! We have a family business and wireless was needed in the next building over. This thing was strong enough to reach into the next building in all rooms. For business use I did not need the 5GHZ range and I am only using the 2.4GHZ range. If you are looking for range this guy is great. I can not speak for the 5GHZ range, but that normally is not as good as 2.4 anyways. Ordered a 2nd one and am not as happy as first, 2nd one was not new, had been already opened cables and parts were just thrown in box. I expect a new product not used!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rickey Moore

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic signal strength and throughput.
customer_reviews.text: This covers both floors of my 2700sq ft studio, office, dressing rooms, workshop and even maintains solid streaming across the parking lot. I would p[refer the USB 3.0 port be on the back for leaving a network drive plugged in but that will be upgraded to an Ethernet NAS soon anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Brousseau Photography

customer_reviews.title: certainly a great improvement over the cable company router that it replaced
customer_reviews.text: A fast router, certainly a great improvement over the cable company router that it replaced. But I am finally writing a review because of the excellent service ASUS provided when the router stopped working after six months. It took three calls on my part before all my issues were resolved, but my contacts with ASUS service personnel were very good. Sometimes hard to understand them due to one person's accent and the background noise of all the other service technicians helping clients while you are trying to hear your guy. I am not a computer whiz, and I appreciate the patience of those helping to solve my problem by phone.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: "Upgraded" from the rt-ac66u and began experiencing intermittent network connectivity ...
customer_reviews.text: "Upgraded" from the rt-ac66u and began experiencing intermittent network connectivity issues on multiple devices. These same devices worked flawlessly using my previous router in the same physical locations of my house. Reconnecting the devices usually restores the connection, but at times, the issue can occur multiple times a day. I have been living with this issue for about 3 months now. Using the latest firmware. This may be just an issue with my router, but I am seeing very similar reports from many people here on amazon and other forums.
customer_reviews.author: Nick C

customer_reviews.title: RT-AC87U - Little more than a pricey paperweight
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it is a lemon or the entire model is bugged but it was malfunctioning from day one and even after multiple firmware updates it would either disconnect its wireless connections or just space out and lose the net feed requiring wireless connections to have to be manually disconnected and then reconnected to restore internet access. This happened multiple times per day, sometimes as often as three or four times an hour. Also rebooting the router would cause the 5G side of the wireless connection to become unavailable requiring multiple reboots of the router to get the 5G side up.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Leeling

customer_reviews.title: Route that traffic.... route it!
customer_reviews.text: Most people know that your internet speed depend on the quality of your router. I am very pleased with this router to say the least! The personal cloud feature is really great too! Purchase if you want a great, fast, router and you want to tweak settings. Don't purchase if you like rebooting your wrt54g all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Joel M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for multi devices & distance
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup and I am a novice. The area coverage is great! We have an unusual setup in our home and there are many walls to go through. Works perfectly! We have about an acre and I can still get a good quality signal at the end of the property. We have many devices that run simultaneously. With 3 teenagers and their friends, we run a minimum of 2 laptops, desktop, PS3, ps4, plus multiple phones, iPads & iPods. It handles them all! Something to keep mind... We needed to upgrade our modem for it to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: I'm told it is one of the better ones.
customer_reviews.text: I'm told it is one of the better ones .... I guess I like it; however my Netgear (even though it was older) worked much better .... one function I do like about this is it tells me before I click into a suspicious website; that is invaluable .... which is why I gave this 4 stars ..
customer_reviews.author: kimseesyou2

customer_reviews.title: It's fast.. when it works. I did ...
customer_reviews.text: It's fast..when it works. I did research on this router/other AC routers on cnet, etc. so I gave it a shot. Those reviews probably received commission. I just installed this in my apartment and right off the bat it performed. However, soon after it started to drop my 2.4 connection repeatedly and WAN connection, never staying stable for longer than 5 minutes at a time. I have the latest firmware and tried to hard resetting and cycling the power but the problem keeps coming up. Now it doesn't even let me connect to it. I'm intending to return it tomorrow and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Tran

customer_reviews.title: Asus RT-AC87U Router and a printer - NOT!
customer_reviews.text: This Asus router is a very good router unless you have a printer connected to your network. I have a Brother printer and it is not compatible with this router. Asus's customer service forwarded to me their list of printers that would be compatible, and it showed about 5 printers (Epson, HP). I did not want a new printer, mine works great, so I have returned the Asus Router. Please make sure, if you have a computer on your network, to check the list of compatible printers.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter's Grove

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Router
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this router for about a year now on my 100Mb/100Mb Fibre line, without a single glitch. I have easily found my way around the user interface, managed to load a VPN easily, and the signal strength is super good. even my neighbors can pick up some of my wifi signal on their phones, so the reach is great. Not a days hassle with this router, so i would easily recommend it to anyone needing a powerful Fibre/adsl router.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Original packaging missing as well as power adapter. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Original packaging missing as well as power adapter. I had to buy the power adapter just to get the router to turn on and after that the router software kept dropping the internet connection. Nightmare purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Pibs

customer_reviews.title: not sure what did it but it always seemed to run super hot. Purchased it in April of '15
customer_reviews.text: Functioned alright while it lasted. Seemed to work okay on some of my devices, but others seemed to suffer intermittent connection problems, would have to restart their wireless adapters to get them to run again. Then finally it just died the other night, not sure what did it but it always seemed to run super hot. Purchased it in April of '15, and it's now March of '17, so not quite two years. Not sure the lifespan of routers, but that doesn't seem great. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Caron

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, gigantic, and arrived with the 5GHz radio DOA.
customer_reviews.text: Called tech support for the 5GHz issue and was told to return it after a brief troubleshooting session. To their credit, they were open on a Sunday and answered the call quickly, so kudos there. Wish QA on the hardware was better. Update: A firmware update solved the 5GHz issue. For a few weeks. After my wife's laptop couldn't connect on the 5GHz band, I rebooted the router. Now it's back to showing "5 GHz radio is not ready" on the wireless log. Power-cycled, same thing. I bought my first router in 2000, and have had many...this is without a doubt the least reliable, most frustrating router of them all.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to replace my Netgear N900. Great router with an extremely adverse interface. It can be used as a very casual home router or can be used in a very nice advanced mode for someone like myself who likes to tweak different aspects. The cloud storage functionality is awesome, I store all my SONOs music on a hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: Bad GUI, poor performance in my usage. Not many options to adjust.
customer_reviews.text: The unit seems to be okay. The drawback looks to be the software and firmware. The 5ghz was dropping the SSID a bit. Cannot adjust power. GUI is a convoluted. I don't think the 4 antennas helps range much because people were having trouble getting on during a Tradeshow setup. During the actual Tradeshow the unit pretty much became a paperweight due to all the interference in the hall (pretty standard) but I was having issues getting throughput when I was situated right next to the router. Will look for third party firmware such as DD-WRT and see if that helps some of the issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jared B

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 4 months then stopped maintaining wireless connections and ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 4 months then stopped maintaining wireless connections and Wan Connections. Upgraded to recent firmware and it became more erratic. Restored to factory setting and it still was malfunctioning. Will try to return it under warranty to ASUS. Will update, based on response, which don't look promising, from ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Garnick

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the router so far
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the router so far. I have AT&T Fiber internet and paired with this router I am experiencing wireless speeds for my IOS devices we could never imagine before. Easy to set up and use. Only con was the keyholes on the bottom of the router for mounting on a wall are difficult to find screws to fit in. Had to use nails to fit in.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria S

customer_reviews.title: Worst router I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome router. Faster than everthing I had. EDIT: 11/29/2015 After 2 months, the router started to behave strangely. Currently upgraded to Firmware 3.0.0.4.378_9313. Tried going back to previous firmwares with no luck. LAN Port1 not working, constantly blinking, not assigning IP no nothing. Was working with some other devices, now it's not working with ANY DEVICE. Wireless TAB, the whole configuration page has all but gone, with no tabs anywhere and just a single pane in the middle of the screen on which I can't do anything. Router constantly rebooting automatically, whenever the front panel Wifi-ON/OFF button is pressed. NO 5ghz WIERELESS available. Wireless log shows: "5GHz not ready" This is the best NOT-WORKING router I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Basara

customer_reviews.title: Good range but... Link Aggregation does not work with current firmware 3.0.0.4.376_2061
customer_reviews.text: Good 2.4GHz and AC 5GHz range... BUT Teaming Ports / Link Aggregation does not work and breaks 5GHz radio: Connecting both lan ports #1 and #2 as link aggregation disables the 5GHz radio. The managed switched at other end of the link aggregation (Netgear GS108T) reports the link aggregation connection as down. Tried this with two new RT-AC87U, both had the same issue. Called ASUS support they informed me to not use link aggregation until a new firmware update to address this problem could be released.
customer_reviews.author: FxT

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up. Has been performing perfectly since I bought it..
customer_reviews.text: One of the nice things about this unit is that I never have to reboot it which I find unusual. Most of my experience with other brand wifi routers I've owned is that they require periodic reboots.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Shindler

customer_reviews.title: I've definitely had better. In order to maintain client wi-fi connections
customer_reviews.text: Once I finally got this thing working, it's okay. I've definitely had better. In order to maintain client wi-fi connections, I had to setup a defined MAC address list for wireless - otherwise, clients disconnect 5-6x per hour, just as many others have experienced. Now I disconnect 2-3x in a day. When it works, it's fast... It should be straightforward and work correctly without having to obtain all client MAC addresses, but it simply doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: D. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best!
customer_reviews.text: Really don't have any negatives about this router. It's very customizable, a solid performer and the build quality is great. I've never had to reboot the router and wifi is solid with great range. Child safe settings are great, you can setup a VPN or use your VPN provider credentials for added security. I enjoy their mobile app and the secure SSH settings built into the router.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME! IT ROCKS!
customer_reviews.text: This thing ROCKS! With 5 others living in my house, and most streaming videos, this was a MUST GET! I absolutely love the web interface, and the Ai-Protection features. This allows me to keep tight tabs over who uses what on my Wi-Fi network. I paired this with AT&T Uverse 1Gb fiber, and it screams! I plan to stream 4K content from Amazon and Netflix!
customer_reviews.author: Dotnettex

customer_reviews.title: Persistent Reboots
customer_reviews.text: Router works for approximately 3-4 days and then disconnects all clients and needs to be rebooted, sometimes the reboots happen multiple times a day. I have updated firmware and found no resolution through ASUS. I would not recommend this router nor will I purchase from ASUS again.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Great range, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is going to be short and sweet. This Router is WAY more than I expected. The range is amazing and fully covers my house (5000sqft) which is a pleasant surprise as I was planning on purchasing a secondary AP. The user interface is very intuitive even with all the advanced features that it provides. I watched several videos on this router before purchasing, so that probably helped with knowing what the capabilities are and how to enable the features I was waiting for. I was in the market due to my previous router needing to be reset every few days (even after installing DDWRT). I have not had to reset the AC87U once since I installed last month
customer_reviews.author: K. Haberstroh

customer_reviews.title: Great router for VPN functions
customer_reviews.text: The best routers you can buy from a VPN user perspective. I prefer ASUS routers because you can upgrade to the Merlin firmware very easily which includes VPN Server and VPN client features. Much more stable and reliable than some other firmware I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: R Bowman III

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, unreliable and drops connection
customer_reviews.text: 9 month review here: It was great at first. Pretty fast and no issues with dropping connections. Now, less than a year of me owning it, it constantly drops connectivity and is very unreliable. My last router I had was a cheap one and it lasted me several years. I thought that going with this expensive router i'd get my moneys worth, but that's not the case. Do not recommend this product and it was a complete waste of $220.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Don't Wait. This is the router with long range capabilities.
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is OMG. Why did I wait so long? This router has enough range to cover my 1/2 acre lot much less my 3000 sq. ft. 2 floor concrete block house. Excellent reception anywhere in the house or near the house. The features are fantastic however the long range is incredible. Absolutely love this router. I pay for 30 Mb/s internet and suddenly I have 56 Mb/s speed test performance. All devices in the house working at once and no slow downs. That's about 14 devices.
customer_reviews.author: jpalko

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product none the less the 5 ghz network drop ...
customer_reviews.text: Okay first off the four stars because the 5 ghz network will drop while the 2.4 ghz network still runs. Usually have to reset at least once a week for that reason maybe twice sometimes. Other than that the upgrade to this router was definitely worth the money when I look at my speed tests now coming from 23 mbps and 5 upload and then got the Asus and now up knoocking 130 mbps and 12 upload. I was more or less shocked lol. Amazing product none the less the 5 ghz network drop here or there, just a quick reset, ain't no big deal really.
customer_reviews.author: Erik W.

customer_reviews.title: That's fine if I never want to use my canon or ...
customer_reviews.text: Big problems with this router, despite the expense of it. I purchased this so that I could use my personal notebook with the 5 ghz and leave the 2.4 ghz for everyone else... That's fine if I never want to use my canon or HP printer because when I'm on 5 ghz it can't access the printers. Now the ASUS (at 2.4 ghz) keeps dropping the printers. I have to reboot the router and it works fine, for a day or two... then it drops them again. I spent countless hours on the phone with ASUS to no avail on either issue. After 5 months, in the trash it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L Kellough

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable, very fast.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great (albeit expensive) router. I had been fooling around with some cheaper (in both senses of the word) ones, but having to constantly reset/restart because one of another of the 12 connections in my house was having issues was tiresome. With this, I have reduced the time I spend as family tech support to almost completely non-router stuff! I will say, however, that although this will set you up for coming technology, you may not have much currently that can take advantage of the faster connection. Reliability is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: robbmerchant

customer_reviews.title: Great - Amazingly large coverage area!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best coverage and fastest router we've ever had. I was getting pretty frustrated with our old one because we moved into a much bigger, older house with a lot of thick wood and who knows what else to block the signal. This router reliably reaches every spot in our house with only minor speed decreases at the very furthest points. We even get coverage in our back yard. I was thinking I'd have to set up a repeater to get that but this one unit gets good enough coverage out there without it.
customer_reviews.author: M5

customer_reviews.title: The best wireless router I have ever owned hands down
customer_reviews.text: The best wireless router I have ever owned hands down. Provides coverage over my half acre property, gives excellent throughput from my high speed cable modem. Doesn't slow down with multiple users streaming video clips simultaneously etc. I highly recommend this wifi router
customer_reviews.author: FLHXXX

customer_reviews.title: Nice old router
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why they are charging 450 USD for a router that came out so long ago, but I have one of these still going strong in 2020.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great if you're in a crowded wifi area.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a complex with a LOT of wifi networks, at any given time I can see as many as 50 SSID's being broadcast 30 of which are there all the time. This obviously causes problems given just how few channels there available for us to use. I regularly got disconnected, signal would just drop, speed would constantly have to be renegotiated ect ect. Since switching to this router, my connection has significantly become more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Tim B.

customer_reviews.title: RT-N66U works great just want to upgrade to the AC level
customer_reviews.text: Bought this ASUS RT-AC87U to replace my current RT-N66U. RT-N66U works great just want to upgrade to the AC level. I really appreciate the advanced ASUS wireless router features, AiProtection, Traffic Analyzer, Adaptive QoS, and so on. Plus the firmware is being updated very frequent and it supports open source. With RT-AC87U, I don’t need to worry about the connecting quality while downloading movies and playing mobile game. And the coverage is extremely wide. Even at the dead zone like patio and bedroom corner, my phone still has two or three level of wireless signal. The price can be a little bit intimated but you get what you pay for, and it's totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Huang Nai Chia

customer_reviews.title: No disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I had some issues setting it up, but for the most part not bad. This is a pretty good router. I don't really have anything bad to say other then maybe some more features and a little more stable. I had some issues with the parental controls, but over time they seem to be getting better. There has been about 5 firmware updates since I've bought it. That's a good thing, means they are improving it more. I would recommend this. It is a nice piece of equipment even with the issues I mentioned above.
customer_reviews.author: NetCom IT Services, Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I was using Asus RT-AC68U and broken down in little over 2years and Upgrade to RT-AC87U this time. My older models was getting about 60 mgs speed with 50mgs speed provider's service plan, now getting over 80 mgs speed with RT-AC87U, some time get 90 mgs speed. I was thinking of upgrading to 100 mgs provider's service plan but it's unnecessary now.
customer_reviews.author: Masazumi Kotani

customer_reviews.title: Works well with a Fios Actiontec router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router to assist my Actiontec mi424wr gen3 router, which was overloaded with 20+ wireless devices. The Actiontec could not be removed from my network because it serves as my Fios modem. The Asus was connected to the Actiontec via a wired LAN to LAN connection. Once the Asus was put in AP mode, and I setup the 2.4 and 5ghz networks, it was up and running without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ebben

customer_reviews.title: This Asus router ROCKS!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Super fast and easy setup!! It increased the wifi reception range all around our house and property by more than three times the distance compared to our old apple router/hard drive. I can go across the street and have the full 3 bars of wifi on my iphone 6! We highly recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.author: KTM300

customer_reviews.title: Best router ever bought, by far.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome router. Finally I got a router that works great. Very fast and although the router is in the garage in the far corner of the house, I get great coverage all over the house and in the basement. I am also using the USB port to back up my music collection. Have a 128gb usb 3 stick connected to it. Transfer speed is very good. Using the DDNS server that asus provides too. This way I can RDC into my main pc without knowing the external ip address. Also works like a charm. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DogSlobberererer

customer_reviews.title: We purchased this because it was recommended as the best
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this because it was recommended as the best! We wanted something reliable as we live in the Caribbean and returning faulty goods is not much of an option as we already had to pay freight and customs duty for it. It constantly gave trouble 'dropping out.' Unfortunately by the time we realised that it had stopped working altogether, the return policy had expired. Would not recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by our cable company service guy
customer_reviews.text: Great wireless router and super easy to install and set-up. Our speed and coverage through a very large 2 story house is amazing. We were using the router built into the cable Gateway system and it sucked. I have a 100 Meg service and could barely get 40 at my laptop in the room directly below the system. Called the cable company to trouble-shoot and guy said dump the cable wireless router and buy an Asus. He was right.
customer_reviews.author: MJH1948

customer_reviews.title: May be the best firewall/router in consumer grade
customer_reviews.text: Love this firewall/router! This one lives up to the hype. I'm a Sr Network Engineer, so I know what I'm talking about. Great feature set that works. Many wireless router manufacturers fail to deliver either WiFi signal strength, a working VPN, a more secure firewall, and even slower WiFi than advertised. But this firewall/router delivers!
customer_reviews.author: TrialedAgain

customer_reviews.title: 5G issues. End up turning off 5G but in light of that still best router I have used for small biz
customer_reviews.text: 5G issues. End up turning off 5G but in light of that still best router I have used for small biz. QoS, SIP, stability, per-machine and per protocol bandwidth monitoring is huge. Great 2.4G coverage. Again- 5G stops working even with their own extender so if you need 5G I can NOT suggest this router. For =everything= else it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford

product_meta.title: Asus RT-AC87U Wireless AC2400 Dual-Band Gigabit Router, Parental Controls - Monitor and Filter Internet Activities for Your Family and Children
product_meta.description:
Style Name:AC2400 Mbps Dual BandEnter a new era of wireless performance with faster-than-incredible speeds, the widest-ever coverage and more control and security than you ever thought possible. RT-AC87U delivers the world's fastest speeds of up to 1734 Mbps at 5 GHz — even faster than tri-band 3x3 routers — plus class-leading concurrent 600 Mbps speeds at 2.4 GHz for an amazing total bandwidth of 2334 Mbps! This means RT-AC87U gives you lag-free online gaming, silky-smooth 4K/UHD video streaming, and effortlessly copes with even the most bandwidth-demanding tasks. With a separate high-gain antenna for each of the four spatial data streams, this power-packed router gives you true 4x4 multi-user MIMO (MU-MIMO) wireless performance that smokes the competition — and it delivers top performance for all your wireless devices, even those using older Wi-Fi standards. As with all ASUS networking products, you get the very best support with the widest range of device compatibility, plus free firmware updates for years to come — so your RT-AC87U will always be at the forefront.

BOX CONTAINS
1 x RT-AC87U Wireless-AC2400 Dual Band Gigabit Router
1 x RJ-45 Lead
1 x Power adapter
Quick start guide
Software Disk
feature_bullets: World’s first 4x4 MU-MIMO antenna design with AiRadar universal beamforming for unrivalled multi-device performance and wireless signal coverage up to 465 m² (around 5,000ft²)1
Ultra-fast 802.11ac Wi-Fi router with a combined dual-band data rate of 2334 Mbps for smooth up to 4K/UHD video playback, ultra-fast file-sharing of large files and low-latency online gaming.
Built-in USB 2.0 and USB 3.0 ports for up to 10-times faster data transfers to USB storage devices2, printer sharing, and 3G/4G dongle support.Enhanced media server (AiPlayer app compatible)
Supports Time Machine backups with Apple devices

specifications.Operating System: Ubuntu 10.04, Ubuntu 10.10, Ubuntu 11.04, Ubuntu 11.10, Ubuntu 12.04, Ubuntu 12.10, Ubuntu 13.04, Ubuntu 13.10, Ubuntu 14.04, Ubuntu 8.04, Ubuntu 8.10, Ubuntu 9.04, Ubuntu 9.10
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars5,211 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
